meta.title: What's New
meta.description: Tabber has been updated! Check out the new features and improvements.

1.5.title: Tabber Updated to Version 1.5
1.5.subtitle: Discover the Latest Features and Enhancements

content_main.title: Exclude Groups from Preservation
description: You can now exclude specific tab groups from being preserved. Simply add groups to the exclusion list using their name or color. Not available in Firefox.
This feature is available under Settings → Exclusions → Groups Exclusions.

content_main.title: Detect Unsaved Form Inputs
description: Tabber now checks for unsaved form inputs before preserving a tab. If unsaved changes are detected, the tab will not be preserved, helping you avoid accidental data loss.
Enable this feature under Settings → Auto Preserve → Don't Preserve Tabs with Unsaved Form Inputs.

content_main.title: Save YouTube Timestamps
description: Tabs with YouTube videos can now be preserved along with their timestamps, allowing you to resume playback from where you left off.
You can activate this option under Settings → Sites Features → Save YouTube Timestamps.

content_main.title: Identify Tabs and Groups by Title
description: Tabs and groups can now be identified by their title instead of internal IDs. This resolves the issue that after restarting some browsers (such as Google Chrome), the auto-preservation timer was reset, as well as the connection between groups in the browser and in Tabber.
Find this option under Settings → Advanced Settings → Identify Tabs by Title.

content_main.title: Confirmation for Critical Actions
description: Tabber now requires a double-click confirmation for critical actions, such as preserving or restoring all tabs, to prevent accidental changes.

content_additional.title: Other Improvements
description: You can now switch the active tab using arrow keys for faster navigation.
A support button has been added to the extension popup.
Resolved an issue with making previews for inactive tabs.
